Title: Corticocortical connections of area F3 (SMA-proper) and area F6 (Pre-SMA) in the macaque monkey

@BrainMaps.Comments: For the superior temporal sulcus the nomenclature of SP78 was chosen, for the prefrontal cortex (except area 46) that of W40 and for the principal sulcus that of PG91a.

@BrainMaps_Delineation.Citation:
"Nissl- and cytochrome-oxidase stained material was used to identify the various areas of the agranular frontal cortex following the criteria defined by Matelli et al. (1985, 1991)." (pp. 117-118)
"Four monkeys (cases 1-4) were prepared for chronic microstimulation and recording experiments ... Intracortical microstimulation was performed with tungsten microelectrodes (impedance 0..5-1.5 mega Ohm, measured at 1 KHz frequency). Trains (50 ms) duration were of cathodral pulses (0.2 ms duration) were delivered at 330 Hz ... In the remaining four monkeys (cases 5-8) the precentral motor cortex was mapped under general anaesthesia ... The cortical surface was electrically stimulated with low impedance (0.5 mega Ohm) tungsten microelectrodes, placed on the pial surface under microscopic control. The following stimulus parameters were used: pulse duration 0.2 ms, pulse frequency 300 Hz, train duration 36 ms. The current intensity necessary to evoke peripheral movements near the central sulcus was between 0.3 and 0.5 mA. These currents evoked clearly defined and strictly localized movements." (p. 116)

@BrainMaps_UnspecificAdoption.Comments: For the superior temporal sulcus the nomenclature of SP78 was chosen, for the prefrontal cortex (except area 46) that of W40 and for the principal sulcus that of PG91a.

p. 114: "The present data support the notion that the classical SMA comprises two functionally distinct areas...F6 (the rostral area)...F3 (the caudal area)..." / p. 128: "F3 and F6...have been traditionally referred to jointly as the supplementary motor area ('SMA')." / "Classically" defined SMA (p. 114): PW51, WSMal52
@InterMapRelations.Comments: This notion contradicts MLR85 and MLR91 where F3 alone is considered to be the equivalent of SMA.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: p. 114: "The present data support the notion that the classical SMA comprises two functionally distinct areas...F6 (the rostral area)...F3 (the caudal area)..." / p. 128: "F3 and F6...have been traditionally referred to jointly as the supplementary motor area ('SMA')." / "Classically" defined SMA (p. 114): PW51, WSMal52

@Injections.Citation: "Figure 3 illustrates the pattern of retrograde cortical connections following injection in the rostral part of F3 (arm field)." (p. 118)

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments:
Whenever label is described by reference to physiological subfields, findings relating to areas F1, F3, F6 are described twice: (i) referring to the entire area, (ii) referring to a specific physiologically defined subfield. The latter information is more specific, while the former allows to include the quantitative data from Table 3 that refer to the entire areas.
Quantitative data from Table 3 were not included if they referred to a conglomerate of different areas simultaneously. Instead, only those data from Table 3 were represented that are related to one specific area.
Prefrontal areas were described by the authors to lack label completely (p. 120). Since this paper did not refer to any parcellation scheme of prefrontal cortex at all, the non-labelling of prefrontal areas is described by reference to the nomenclature of Walker (1940).

@LabelledSites_Data.Comments: In contrast to the statement in the text (p. 120: "The rostral part of area 24d, from which leg movements are evoked, is completely devoid of labelling."), Figure 3 does show label in the rostral parts of area 24d.
The following description probably refers to area PS82-POa: "... no labelling is observed in the lateral bank of the intraparietal sulcus and the adjacent convexity ... " (p. 125)

@Injections.Citation: "The corticocortical connections of F6 were studied in three cases ... The connection pattern following the rostral injection (case 4l) is shown in Figure 12." (p. 125)
@Injections.Comments: Table 1 shows that this injection affected the arm representation in area F6.

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: The mentioned labelling of "...the mesial prefrontal cortex and and on the adajacent convexity just anterior to F6..." (p. 125) was interpreted as area 8B (W40) and the "Two labelled zones...in the cortex dorsal and ventral to the principal sulcus..." as areas 46d and 46v (PG91a). The description of other labelled prefrontal regions was to vague to allow justified interpretation.

@Injections.Citation: "Figure 5 illustrates the pattern of retrograde cortical connections following injection of the caudal part of F3 (leg field)." (p. 120)

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments:
Whenever label is described by reference to physiological subfields, findings relating to areas F1, F3, F6 are described twice: (i) referring to the entire area, (ii) referring to a specific physiologically defined subfield. The latter information is more specific, while the former allows to include the quantitative data from Table 3 that refer to the entire areas.
Quantitative data from Table 3 were not included if they referred to a conglomerate of different areas simultaneously. Instead, only those data from Table 3 were represented that are related to one specific area.

@LabelledSites_Data.Comments: The following description probably refers to area PS82-POa: "... no labelling is observed in the lateral bank of the intraparietal sulcus and the adjacent convexity ... " (p. 125)
The following description probably refers to area PS82-PEA: "A few, sparse cells were found in the medial bank of the intraparietal sulcus." (p. 123)

@Injections.Citation: "Distribution of retrogradely lablled cells in area 24d following two tracer injections (FG, open circles and TB, filled circles) in the leg field of F1 in case 4r." (legend to Fig. 9C)
"Figure 15 shows another case (case 1) in which the tracer was injected in the caudal part of F6. The injection was smaller than in case 4r and largely restricted to the cortical crown." (p. 128)
@Injections.Comments: Table 1 shows that this injection affected that subfield of F6 which represents axial movements.

@Injections.Citation: "Figure 14 illustrates the pattern of retrograde cortical connections following tracer injection in the caudal part of F6 (case 4r)." (p. 125)
@Injections.Comments: Table 1 shows that this injection affected the arm representation in area F6.

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: The mentioned labelling of prefrontal cortex anterior to F6 (p. 128) was interpreted as area 8B (W40) and the the "Labelled cells...in the cortex dorsal and ventral to the principal sulcus..." as areas 46d and 46v (PG91a). The description of other labelled prefrontal regions was to vague to allow justified interpretation.

@Injections.Citation: "Distribution of retrogradely labelled cells in area 24d following tracer injections in the arm field of F1 in two animals (case 6, WGA-HRP, open circles, and case 8, FB, filled circles)." (legend to Fig. 9B)

"Figure 6 shows the cortical areas labelled after injection of the dorsal part of F3. In this case, although the injection site was large and not circumscribed to a single physiological field, the results of microstimulation and the comparison with somatotopic maps suggest that the injection mostly involved the cortex controlling axial movements." (p. 120)

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: Prefrontal areas, that generally lacked labelling (p. 120), were described according to the nomenclature of W40.

@Injections.Citation: "The injection site in case 3 (Fig. 8) is located at the center of F3 and invades its dorsal and mesial cortical surfaces. Physiologically, the injection corresponds to the axial and arm movement representation of F3." (pp. 120-121)

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: Prefrontal areas, that generally lacked labelling (p. 121), were described according to the nomenclature of W40.

@Injections.Citation: "...injections of WGA-HRP in different somatotopic fields of F1 in three animals ... Open circles represent the labelling following injection in the leg representation [of F1] (case 5) ..." (legend to Fig. 9A)

"...injections of WGA-HRP in different somatotopic fields of F1 in three animals ... filled circles represent the labelling following injection in the arm representation [of F1] (case 6) ..." (legend to Fig. 9A)

"...injections of WGA-HRP in different somatotopic fields of F1 in three animals ... triangles show the labelling following injection in the face representation [of F1] (case 7) ..." (legend to Fig. 9A)
"Distribution of retrogradely lablled cells in area 24d following two tracer injections (FG, open circles and TB, filled circles) in the leg field of F1 in case 4r." (legend to Fig. 9C)

publication.title: Corticocortical connections of area F3 (SMA-proper) and area F6 (Pre-SMA) in the macaque monkey
